Class Event

java.lang.Object
Event
public class Event
extends java.lang.Object
Event class consists of possible event processes: Arrival, Wait, Leaves, Done.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Event​(java.util.PriorityQueue<Customer> customerList, Server servant)
    Event constructor to set up information relating to statistics and customers in the queue.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void allProcess()
    Handles all the events happening in the queue.
    void arrivalProcess​(Customer c)
    Takes care of the first Arrival of each customer where: A server serves the customer when the customer arrives and need not wait.
    void doneProcess()
    The customer has been completely served and if there is a waitlisted customer, the customer can be added back into the queue.
    void printStatistics()
    Prints all the statistics about the queue events which consist of: The average waiting time for customers who have been served.
    void serveProcess​(Customer c)
    The customer can be served, and will be added back to the queue.
    void waitProcess​(Customer c)
    The customer has to wait, and will be waitlisted.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event​(java.util.PriorityQueue<Customer> customerList, Server servant)
      Event constructor to set up information relating to statistics and customers in the queue.
      Parameters:
      customerList - Customers in the queue.
      servant - Creates the very first servant.

  • Method Details

    • arrivalProcess

      public void arrivalProcess​(Customer c)
      Takes care of the first Arrival of each customer where: A server serves the customer when the customer arrives and need not wait. The customer has to wait if the server is serving a customer. The customer leaves if there is someone already waiting.
      Parameters:
      c - The customer that just arrived.

    • waitProcess

      public void waitProcess​(Customer c)
      The customer has to wait, and will be waitlisted.
      Parameters:
      c - The customer that has to wait.

    • serveProcess

      public void serveProcess​(Customer c)
      The customer can be served, and will be added back to the queue.
      Parameters:
      c - The customer that can be served.

    • doneProcess

      public void doneProcess()
      The customer has been completely served and if there is a waitlisted customer, the customer can be added back into the queue.

    • printStatistics

      public void printStatistics()
      Prints all the statistics about the queue events which consist of: The average waiting time for customers who have been served. The number of customers served. The number of customers who left without being served.

    • allProcess

      public void allProcess()
      Handles all the events happening in the queue.
